coredata.dc:title: The Thermal Infrared Visual Object Tracking VOT-TIR2015 Challenge Results
coredata.prism:publicationName: Proceedings of the IEEE International Conference on Computer Vision
coredata.dc:publisher: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers Inc.

abstract.ce:para: The Thermal Infrared Visual Object Tracking challenge 2015, VOT-TIR2015, aims at comparing short-term single-object visual trackers that work on thermal infrared (TIR) sequences and do not apply pre-learned models of object appearance. VOT-TIR2015 is the first benchmark on short-term tracking in TIR sequences. Results of 24 trackers are presented. For each participating tracker, a short description is provided in the appendix. The VOT-TIR2015 challenge is based on the VOT2013 challenge, but introduces the following novelties: (i) the newly collected LTIR (Link - ping TIR) dataset is used, (ii) the VOT2013 attributes are adapted to TIR data, (iii) the evaluation is performed using insights gained during VOT2013 and VOT2014 and is similar to VOT2015.

affiliation.affilname: Fraunhofer Institute for Optronics, System Technologies and Image Exploitation IOSB
Ceské vysoké ucení technické v Praze
University at Albany State University of New York

citation-title.titletext: The Thermal Infrared Visual Object Tracking VOT-TIR2015 Challenge Results

affiliation.organization: ARC Centre of Excellence for Robotic Vision

abstract.ce:para: The Thermal Infrared Visual Object Tracking challenge 2015, VOT-TIR2015, aims at comparing short-term single-object visual trackers that work on thermal infrared (TIR) sequences and do not apply pre-learned models of object appearance. VOT-TIR2015 is the first benchmark on short-term tracking in TIR sequences. Results of 24 trackers are presented. For each participating tracker, a short description is provided in the appendix. The VOT-TIR2015 challenge is based on the VOT2013 challenge, but introduces the following novelties: (i) the newly collected LTIR (Link - ping TIR) dataset is used, (ii) the VOT2013 attributes are adapted to TIR data, (iii) the evaluation is performed using insights gained during VOT2013 and VOT2014 and is similar to VOT2015.
